importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility.
The black Hyundai Accent was reportedly seen on video at a recreation center on this date, near where Scott’s body was later found.
The remains were discovered behind an abandoned school on this date, leading to the confirmation of Kada Scott’s identity via DNA testing.
A news conference was held on this date to announce the discovery of the remains and the arrest of Keon King, with prosecutors indicating potential homicide charges.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline begins with the reported disappearance of Kada Scott on this date, which marks the start of the investigation and the subsequent events involving the stolen car and the discovery of her remains.
Between Oct. 7 and 10, investigators returned to the school site after receiving a new tip, leading to the discovery of the remains in a shallow grave.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for about two weeks, were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
DNA testing confirmed the identity of the remains, which were discovered in a shallow grave after an anonymous tip prompted a return to the previously searched location.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and potentially homicide.
Prosecutors allege that King had cellphone contact with Scott and used a stolen black Hyundai Accent, which was seen on video near the site of the body and later burned at a junkyard.
The vehicle was reported stolen a day before Scott disappeared and was found on fire three days later, raising suspicion of connection to the case.
King was previously arrested in another case involving a kidnapping and assault but charges were dropped due to lack of witness appearances.
Authorities say there may be other individuals involved in the case, and investigations are ongoing into possible additional involvement.
Kada Scott’s parents described her as a source of light, kindness, and a beautiful spirit, and expressed deep grief over her disappearance and death.
District Attorney Larry Krasner emphasized that homicide charges are under consideration but are being pursued legally and constitutionally, without taking shortcuts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing in Philadelphia, were discovered behind an abandoned school in a shallow grave after an anonymous tip prompted a return to the site. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Prosecutors allege that King had contact with Scott via cellphone and used a stolen black Hyundai Accent, which was seen on video near the site of her remains and later burned. King previously faced charges in a separate kidnapping case, which were dropped due to lack of testimony. Authorities say more charges are in development and that others may be involved. Kada Scott’s parents described her as a source of light and kindness, and expressed deep grief over her loss. District Attorney Larry Krasner emphasized that homicide charges are being considered but are being pursued in accordance with the law.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
